title: Note to the Reader
publication_title: Pissarro Paintings and Works on Paper at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section body" id="body">We recommend using the latest version of Chrome, Safari, or Firefox.

We welcome your questions and comments about the publication at OnlineCatalogueFeedback@artic.edu.

Due to the pioneering publishing platform of this catalogue, we are including the following citation guide for your reference.

Richard R. Brettell, “Cat. 3: Snow at Louveciennes, c. 1870: Curatorial Entry,” in Pissarro Paintings and Works on Paper at the Art Institute of Chicago, eds. Gloria Groom and Genevieve Westerby (Art Institute of Chicago, 2015), para X.

Kelly Keegan, “Cat. 3: Snow at Louveciennes, c. 1870: Technical Report,” in Pissarro Paintings and Works on Paper at the Art Institute of Chicago, eds. Gloria Groom and Genevieve Westerby (Art Institute of Chicago, 2015), para X.

“Cat. 3: Snow at Louveciennes, c. 1870: Provenance,” in Pissarro Paintings and Works on Paper at the Art Institute of Chicago, eds. Gloria Groom and Genevieve Westerby (Art Institute of Chicago, 2015), para X.

“Cat. 3: Snow at Louveciennes, c. 1870: Exhibition History,” in Pissarro Paintings and Works on Paper at the Art Institute of Chicago, eds. Gloria Groom and Genevieve Westerby (Art Institute of Chicago, 2015), para X.

“Cat. 3: Snow at Louveciennes, c. 1870: Selected References,” in Pissarro Paintings and Works on Paper at the Art Institute of Chicago, eds. Gloria Groom and Genevieve Westerby (Art Institute of Chicago, 2015), para X.

“Cat. 3: Snow at Louveciennes, c. 1870: Other Documentation,” in Pissarro Paintings and Works on Paper at the Art Institute of Chicago, eds. Gloria Groom and Genevieve Westerby (Art Institute of Chicago, 2015), para X.

“Mrs. Lewis Larned (Annie Swan) Coburn,” in Pissarro Paintings and Works on Paper at the Art Institute of Chicago, eds. Gloria Groom and Genevieve Westerby (Art Institute of Chicago, 2015), para. X.

This digital publication is powered by ChicagoCodeX (CCX), an open source suite of software tools which provides an authoring and publishing environment for online catalogues with full scholarly apparatus; intuitive book-like navigation; robust presentation tools for complex, multilayered images; and personalized reader annotation tools.

The OSCI team at the Art Institute of Chicago conceived and managed the project and the development of the ChicagoCodex, which served as the foundation of the open-sourced, digital publishing platform OSCI Toolkit (oscitoolkit.com). The project’s impetus and funding came from the Getty Foundation. The initial coding and technical implementation was researched and executed by the IMA Lab, a Web design and development consultancy of the Indianapolis Museum of Art.

Ludovic Rodo Pissarro and Lionello Venturi, Camille Pissarro: Son art—son oeuvre, 2 vols. (P. Rosenberg, 1939).

Joachim Pissarro and Claire Durand-Ruel Snollaerts, with the collaboration of Alexia de Buffévent and Annie Champié, Pissarro: Catalogue critique des peintures/Critical Catalogue of Paintings, 3 vols., trans. Mark Hutchinson and Michael Taylor (Skira/Wildenstein Institute, 2005).

Loys Delteil, supplemented by Jean Cailac, Camille Pissarro: L’oeuvre gravé et lithographié/The Etchings and Lithographs; Catalogue Raisonné, ed. Alan Hyman (Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1999).

</section>
